heading: TARGETED MUSCLES: Back of legs. WHAT YOU NEED: Bench or other hard surface, such as two chairs placed together. TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR: If you've had hip or back surgery, talk with your doctor before trying this stretch. Here's another exercise that stretches the muscles in the back of your legs. If you've had hip or back surgery, talk with your doctor before trying this stretch.

steps.1: Sit sideways on a bench or other hard surface, such as two chairs placed together.
steps.2: Keeping back straight, stretch one leg out on the bench, toes pointing up.
steps.3: Keep other foot flat on the floor.
steps.4: If you feel a stretch at this point, hold position for 10-30 seconds.
steps.5: If you don't feel a stretch, lean forward from hips (not waist) until you feel stretching in the leg on the bench.
steps.8: Repeat at least 3-5 times with your other leg.
